title: Father Cotton a Iesuite, the Kings confessour, his two and thirtie demands, to the ministers of France with the answeres added at the end of euerie demand. Also threescore and foure demands proposed to Father Cotton, by way of counter-change. By Peter Moulin, minister of the word of God in the church of Paris. Printed according to the French copie, printed in Paris. Also a new late chalenge, by a learned diuine, to all Papists, in 24. other Popish articles.
author: Du Moulin, Pierre, 1568-1658.
publisher: Printed [by Thomas Snodham] for Iohn Barnes, and are to be sould at his shop, ouer against S. Sepulchers Church, without New-gate,
notes: Translator's dedication signed: I.B., i.e. John Barnes?.
A translation of: Trente-deux demandes propos√©es par le P. Cotton.
Includes a translation of Coton's demands.
The second English edition, according to STC.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
